Dialogue.Page: Hey there recruit, I'm glad you've made it this far!

DialogueOption.Text: What's there to explore around here?
How is it possible to live here?

Dialogue.Page: There's a Precursor ruin not far from here that you can check out, it seems every planet in this system has at least one.
What I don't understand, is that it's built into the bedrock. That means it was buried under hundreds of feet of ice and water before this planet warmed up!
I don't understand how that's possible! The precursor ruins must be extremely old.
You can also visit the West Settlement, but I'd be wary of that place, it's very dangerous, and a little grim.
I know right? It's amazing that this place is as habitable as it is!
The constant mysterious generation of heat keeps this place a livable temperature, if a little warm.
And the heat melted and evaporated the ice, creating a breathable atmosphere!
There's no native life on this planet, but we've introduced algae in the lakes which act as a food source.
Makes me a little nervous though, what if the heat goes away, or it gets even hotter?
But hey, we need a place to stay!
The lightning? Not at all, it's just content to jump between the clouds.
The tornadoes though are extremely dangerous, even more so than normal tornadoes.
They have a core of electrified plasma that'll fry ya!
They only form in the lower elevations though.
